Agreeably to the last Will and Testament of Issac
,lcaough. late Of White Clay Greek Hundred, in
the County of Newcastle Del deceased will be
sold by public endue, on Monday the 24th day Of
December. inst. upon the premises,


a V.lLU.lBLE PL.lNllIION,
Containing two hundred and thirty acres, situate
upon the great road leading from Newark to Chris
tiana Bridge, about equally distant from each and
at the forks of the road leading to Stanton-wlthin
three miles Of the great Southern mail route, and
convenient TO the landings at Newport, ChrlstIana
and Elltton; also to several mills and places OF
worship Of different denominations and contains d
fair and desirable proportion Of wood, meadow, and
arabic land. The cleared land is under good fence
and divided into enclosures Of a handsome shape
and convenient size.


IA On the premises are erected a convenient
la.h and comfortable dwelling house part
thereof nearly new, in good repair, and sufficiently
large to accommodate two families, log barn, and
also new frame Granary, also an apple orch
ard and other fruit trees. The neghboUrhood is
healthy and the society is moral and agreeable.


This farm has never before been in the market,
having been the residence of the deceased for near
thirty years, and farmed constantly under his own
care and direction.


For further information and view Of the pre-
misses apply to Mr. Nicholas lie Haray, contiguous
London r Roads, Chester County, Pennsy ylvania.
Hour of sale Q o clock, P. M. Conditions at sale.


JOHN MENOUGH, }r.,

TO .aLL TEACHERS AND PARENTS.

THIS Institution will be opened on Monday


the 22d. of October Inst, under the care


ofthe Rev. JOSEPH WILSON.


In this Seminary students will be thoroughly In
structed in the different branches Of agood English
and Classical Education, viz: Reading, Writing,
Arithmetic, English Grammar, Geography, Compo-
stlon, Elocuton, Mathematics, and the Greek and
Latin Languages. The terms of tuition will be (; for
the English branches exclusive of Mathematics,
S8 per session, OF SlO including the Mathematics;
for the Languages, including the English, $40 per
session. Tuition money to be paid i'll advance.
There will be two sessions in the year, with
short vacation between each.


Good boarding can be obtained in respectable
families in the village at the rate of Forty Dollars
per session and few boarders can be accommo-
dated in the family of the Principal.


JOHN EDDOWES. Sec'y.

full articles.article:
THIS Institution will be opened on Monday


the 22d. of October Inst, under the care


ofthe Rev. JOSEPH WILSON.


In this Seminary students will be thoroughly In
structed in the different branches Of agood English
and Classical Education, viz: Reading, Writing,
Arithmetic, English Grammar, Geography, Compo-
stlon, Elocuton, Mathematics, and the Greek and
Latin Languages. The terms of tuition will be (; for
the English branches exclusive of Mathematics,
S8 per session, OF SlO including the Mathematics;
for the Languages, including the English, $40 per
session. Tuition money to be paid i'll advance.
There will be two sessions in the year, with
short vacation between each.


Good boarding can be obtained in respectable
families in the village at the rate of Forty Dollars
per session and few boarders can be accommo-
dated in the family of the Principal.


JOHN EDDOWES. Sec'y.
